title: Stress Type Test
description: How do you experience and cope with stress? Find out your stress management style and type!

questions.question: What's the first symptom when you're stressed?
How do you react when a deadline approaches?

choices.text: Get it done with a last-minute sprint
Can't sleep well due to anxiety
Procrastinate as much as possible then somehow do it

questions.question: Your reaction when you make a mistake?

choices.text: Get angry and do something about it
Try to just forget about it

questions.question: When something important suddenly comes up?

choices.text: Tough but get it done somehow
Hard to fall asleep even when tired
Can't sleep until everything is done
Get frustrated and do it myself
Get annoyed but hold it in

questions.question: When going through hard times, you usually...

choices.text: Try harder to do it perfectly
Lose appetite and can't eat well
No time to think about eating

results.title: The Perfectionist
results.description: You pursue perfection even in stressful situations! You set high standards and strive to meet them, but can be hard on yourself in the process. You like being systematic and planned.
results.advice: It's okay not to be perfect. 'Good enough' is good enough. Don't be too hard on yourself. Small mistakes are part of growth. Remember that rest is also productive.

results.title: The Anxious
results.description: You feel a lot of worry and anxiety in stressful situations! You worry about the future and tend to think of worst-case scenarios first. You have a careful and cautious personality.
results.advice: Focus on the present moment. Worrying about things that haven't happened is a waste of energy. Deep breathing and meditation can help. Most things you worry about never actually happen.

results.title: The Explosive
results.description: You're the type whose emotions explode when stress builds up! You usually hold it in, then it all bursts out at once when you reach your limit. You have a passionate and energetic personality.
results.advice: Practice expressing emotions little by little. Bottling them up only leads to bigger explosions. Channeling energy through exercise or hobbies helps. Keeping an emotion journal can also help.

results.title: The Avoider
results.description: You tend to avoid stressful situations! Rather than facing difficulties, you keep your distance and escape through sleep or other activities. You have a peace-seeking personality.
results.advice: Problems don't disappear by avoiding them. Start facing small things gradually. Avoidance only gives temporary relief. It's okay to ask for help from someone you trust.

results.title: The Physical
results.description: You're the type whose stress shows physically! Psychological stress manifests as physical symptoms like headaches, indigestion, and fatigue. Your body and mind are closely connected.
results.advice: Listen to your body's signals. Regular exercise and enough sleep are important. Stretching and yoga can help too. Don't ignore the signals your body sends.
